channel.title: CVE Feed for NVIDIA -- vGPU software (guest driver) - Linux, vGPU software (Virtual GPU Manager), NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (guest driver), NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (Virtual GPU Manager)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NVIDIA -- vGPU software (guest driver) - Linux, vGPU software (Virtual GPU Manager), NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (guest driver), NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (Virtual GPU Manager)

item.title: CVE-2022-34670|2024-08-03T09:15:15.748Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an unprivileged regular user can cause truncation errors when casting a primitive to a primitive of smaller size causes data to be lost in the conversion, which may lead to denial of service or information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-42263|2024-08-03T13:03:45.675Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an Integer overflow may lead to denial of service or information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-34684|2024-08-03T09:15:15.827Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an off-by-one error may lead to data tampering or information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-34674|2024-08-03T09:15:15.865Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where a helper function maps more physical pages than were requested, which may lead to undefined behavior or an information leak.

item.title: CVE-2022-42259|2024-08-03T13:03:45.786Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an integer overflow may lead to denial of service.

item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an integer overflow may lead to information disclosure, data tampering or denial of service.

item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an integer overflow may lead to denial of service, data tampering, or information disclosure.

item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an out-of-bounds read may lead to denial of service, information disclosure, or data tampering.

item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an out-of-bounds array access may lead to denial of service, information disclosure, or data tampering.

item.title: CVE-2022-42264|2024-08-03T13:03:45.935Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer, where an unprivileged regular user can cause the use of an out-of-range pointer offset, which may lead to data tampering, data loss, information disclosure, or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-34679|2024-08-03T09:15:15.697Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an unhandled return value can lead to a null-pointer dereference, which may lead to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-34680|2024-08-03T09:15:16.076Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an integer truncation can lead to an out-of-bounds read, which may lead to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2022-34677|2024-08-03T09:15:15.722Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler, where an unprivileged regular user can cause an integer to be truncated, which may lead to denial of service or data tampering.

item.title: CVE-2022-42256|2024-08-03T13:03:45.913Z -- nvidia -- vgpu%20software%20%28guest%20driver%29%20-%20linux%2C%20vgpu%20software%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29%2C%20nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28virtual%20gpu%20manager%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvidia.ko), where an integer overflow in index validation may lead to denial of service, information disclosure, or data tampering.
